Name: Long Grain Parboiled Rice
Description: Premium quality long grain rice that has been parboiled to preserve nutrients and shorten cooking time.

Description: High-quality black-eyed peas, a staple in Nigerian cuisine, rich in protein and fiber.

Description: Finely ground cassava flakes, a versatile staple food in Nigeria, commonly eaten with soup or soaked in water as a snack.

Name: Semolina
Description: Finely ground semolina flour, used to make a variety of Nigerian dishes such as semolina porridge and fufu.

Name: Millet
Description: Whole millet grains, a nutritious staple in Nigerian cuisine, commonly used to make porridge or as a side dish.

Name: Canned Tomatoes
Description: High-quality canned tomatoes, perfect for making delicious Nigerian stew dishes.

Name: Palm Oil
Description: Pure palm oil extracted from fresh palm fruit, ideal for cooking and adding authentic flavor to Nigerian dishes.

Name: Tomato Paste
Description: Thick, concentrated tomato paste, essential for enhancing the flavor and color of Nigerian dishes.

Name: Canned Beans
Description: High-quality canned beans, convenient for quick and easy preparation in Nigerian recipes.

Name: Canned Fish (Sardines or Mackerel)
Description: Premium quality fish preserved in cans, perfect for adding protein and flavor to Nigerian dishes.

Name: Palm Oil
Description: Pure palm oil extracted from fresh palm fruit, ideal for cooking and adding authentic flavor to Nigerian dishes.

Description: High-quality groundnut oil extracted from peanuts, perfect for frying and cooking Nigerian dishes.

Description: Cold-pressed coconut oil, rich in flavor and ideal for cooking and baking in Nigerian cuisine.

Name: White Vinegar
Description: High-quality white vinegar, perfect for cooking, pickling, and preserving foods in Nigerian recipes.

Name: Granulated Sugar
Description: Fine granulated sugar, perfect for sweetening beverages and desserts in Nigerian cuisine.

Name: Honey
Description: Pure, natural honey sourced locally or imported, ideal for sweetening beverages and desserts in Nigerian cuisine.

Description: Brown sugar with a rich, caramel-like flavor, perfect for baking and sweetening desserts in Nigerian cuisine.

Name: Date Syrup
Description: Sweet and flavorful date syrup, commonly used as a sweetener in some regions of Nigeria.

Description: High-quality all-purpose flour, perfect for baking a variety of Nigerian bread, cakes, and pastries.

Name: Baking Powder
Description: Leavening agent used in baking to help cakes and bread rise, essential for Nigerian baking recipes.

Description: Versatile leavening agent used in baking and cooking, essential for Nigerian recipes like puff-puff and pancakes.

Name: Yeast
Description: Active dry yeast, essential for making Nigerian bread, rolls, and other yeast-based recipes.

Name: Cocoa Powder
Description: High-quality cocoa powder, perfect for making delicious chocolate cakes and treats in Nigerian cuisine.

Name: Salt
Description: Fine sea salt, essential for seasoning and enhancing the flavor of Nigerian dishes.

Name: Maggi or Knorr Seasoning Cubes
Description: Popular seasoning cubes used to enhance the flavor of Nigerian soups, stews, and sauces.

Name: Ground Crayfish
Description: Sun-dried and ground crayfish, adds a rich flavor to Nigerian soups and stews.

Name: Pepper
Description: Hot and spicy pepper, essential for adding heat and flavor to Nigerian dishes.

Name: Curry Powder
Description: A blend of spices, including turmeric and coriander, adds a distinctive flavor and color to Nigerian dishes.

Name: Chin Chin
Description: Crunchy fried pastry, a popular snack in Nigeria enjoyed by all ages.

Name: Plantain Chips
Description: Crispy plantain chips, a delicious and savory snack enjoyed in Nigeria.

Name: Puffed Corn Snacks
Description: Light and crunchy puffed corn snacks, also known as 'guguru' and 'epa', popular street snacks in Nigeria.

Description: Crunchy groundnut cakes made from roasted peanuts, a traditional Nigerian snack.

Description: High-quality coffee beans grown in Nigeria, perfect for brewing rich and flavorful coffee.

Name: Hibiscus Tea (Zobo)
Description: Dried hibiscus flowers used to make refreshing and tangy Zobo drink, popular in Nigeria.

Name: Milo or Ovaltine
Description: Malted beverages like Milo or Ovaltine, enjoyed as a nutritious and delicious drink in Nigeria.

Name: Bottled Palm Wine
Description: Authentic palm wine bottled for convenience, a traditional Nigerian alcoholic beverage.

Name: Instant Powdered Drinks
Description: Instant powdered drinks like Ovaltine or Bournvita, perfect for a quick and tasty beverage in Nigeria.

Name: Dried Fish
Description: Sun-dried fish, commonly used as a flavoring ingredient in Nigerian soups and stews, adding a rich umami taste.

Name: Dried Pepper
Description: Dried and ground pepper, perfect for seasoning Nigerian dishes with a spicy kick.

Name: Dried Crayfish
Description: Sun-dried and smoked crayfish, adds a rich umami flavor to Nigerian soups and stews.

Name: Dried Vegetables (Ugwu Leaves)

Name: Cornflakes

Description: Traditional Nigerian breakfast made from fermented cornmeal, served hot and often paired with akara or moi moi.

Description: Natural coconut flavoring, perfect for adding a tropical twist to Nigerian desserts and beverages.

Description: High-quality groundnuts (peanuts), rich in protein and healthy fats, perfect for snacking or use in Nigerian recipes.

Description: Whole melon seeds (egusi), rich in nutrients and commonly used in Nigerian soups and stews.

Description: Creamy peanut butter, made from high-quality peanuts, perfect for spreading on bread or adding to Nigerian recipes.

Description: Popular seasoning cubes like Maggi or Knorr, essential for adding flavor to Nigerian soups, stews, and sauces.

Name: Dry Pepper
Description: Dried and ground pepper, adds a spicy kick to Nigerian dishes and sauces.
